fun.connor.lighter.example.handlers

Class PersonHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • fun.connor.lighter.example.handlers.PersonHandler

  • @ResourceController(value="/person")
public class PersonHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Lighter ResourceController for Person related operations. This class demonstrates several features of Lighter. First, the person handler has a dependency on the PersonRepository. Lighter uses the InjectionObjectFactory provided at configuration time to construct them. Second, this class contains several different endpoint methods which each demonstrate the usage of different annotations from the fun.connor.lighter.declarative package.

      Create a new handler with a repository for persistence.

    • Method Detail

      • createPerson

        @Post
 @QueryParams(value={"first_name:firstName","last_name:lastName","use_full_name:useFullName"})
public Response<Person> createPerson(java.lang.String firstName,
                                                                                                                                            java.lang.String lastName,
                                                                                                                                            java.util.Optional<java.lang.Boolean> useFullName,
                                                                                                                                            Request request)

      • sayHello

        @Get(value="/say_hello/{firstName}/{lastName}")
public Response<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> sayHello(java.lang.String firstName,
                                                                                                                            java.lang.String lastName,
                                                                                                                            Request request)
        Retrieve a person from the repository and response with a hello message for that person. This method demonstrates Lighter's automatic path parameter marshalling and Lighter's response API.
        Parameters:
        firstName - The first name of the person
        lastName - The last name of the person
        request - the request
        Returns:
        a response with a map containing the hello message.

      • updatePerson

        @Put
public Response<Person> updatePerson(@Body
                                           Person person,
                                           Subject subject)
        Update a person in the repository. This method demonstrates Lighter's Body binding as well as the RequestGuard feature. In this case, the Subject RequestGuard is used to provide authentication information to the endpoint.
        Parameters:
        person - the person to update
        subject - the subject which the response is being executed on the behalf of
        Returns:
        a response with the actual updated person

      • getAll

        @Get(value="/all")
public Response<java.util.List<Person>> getAll()
        Get all people in the repository. This method demonstrates Lighter's ability to serialize arbitrary collections.
        Returns:
        a response with the list of people in the repository
